fun game

(For context, this was my first playthrough of the game, and also one of the first games I've ever played using keyboard and mouse).

Half Life was released in 1999(?) and it definitely shows. The graphics are quite archaic, but remain serviceable nonetheless. The gameplay was the most interesting part for me personally, because it was far more strategic than what I'm used to. While this game is still viewed as one of the defining titles of the FPS genre, I think Its affect on the industry has lessened over time. Not many games uphold this tactical type of gameplay, which does suck, but helps prolong the seldom seen uniqueness of it. I struggled with this game and its many quirks a multitude of times over my entire playthrough because not only does it utilize such a rare form of gameplay (as I mentioned before), I also have not gotten used to keyboard and mouse controls. So this game slowly became a learning experience for me, and that is quite endearing. I'm absolutely more in touch with this control scheme than I was beforehand, and I will always have this game to thank for that.

Honestly, the story is told rather cryptically and any plot elements are either vague, or non-existent. exposition is also rather sparse, which I did appreciate . . . for the most part. I went into this game knowing nothing except Gordon Freeman, G-man, Headcrab, and weird baby I didn't have any context for. I left knowing pretty much the same stuff as before, along with a few smaller details such as Xen, and Black Mesa. I do hope the sequel has a better knack for storytelling than this one (from what I've heard, it does), because this just didn't do it for me.

The design and atmosphere was VERY well done. I was blindsided  by the sudden alien race quickly consuming everything, and I had not anticipated how horror focused some of the chapters are. the earlier chapters were more centered on the grotesque question of "What is happening?", with the latter half forming into disturbing wonder at the answer. but it manages to uphold the sci-fi horror tone the whole way through, and I was a big fan of it.

Overall, the game has without a doubt been hampered by the sands of time and the marching forward of its industry, but it still is very much worth playing, and I for one am glad I chose to do so.

The game started out really slow for me and it was just hard to get into it since its pretty old and the mechanics just didn't feel right or felt too fast at times. The story was a little hard to grasp for me but it was still plenty of fun traveling through the worlds and following the story. Could be a lot better in today's times but I'm glad that there is a remaster for this game. Also, I really like the arsenal of weapons and the ability to use the developer console which allows you to have your own experience. Recommended if you don't mind old mechanics.

Oyun çok iyi ama fiyatı 18.5 olması kötü birşey , ama indirimlerde 3 tl gibi bir fiyata iniyor kesssinlikle alın oyunu beğenmeyeninde olduğunu sanmıyorum zaten ,  grafiklere kötü diyorsanız gidin black mesa satın alın half life 1 in aynısı sadece grafiklerinin daha güzelleştirilmiş hali . Benim bilgisayarım half life 3 ü kaldırmaz gibi lafları zaten söylemenize gerek yok benim bilgisayarımda intel hd graphics 2000 var yani ekran kartım yok . Ona ramen fps 1920x1080 low da 100 fps gibi bir fps alıyorum ama black mesa yı bilmem çünkü onu hiç oynamadım sadece videolarını gördüm.

Never got to experience this game when it came out as i was to young and put off playing it for years, going back and playing it in 2021 i can see why Half life was such a big deal.The controls are good tho platforming is a little janky, level design is also pretty good especially considering when it was made with decent progression throughout the game with new weapons along the way. 


The game has aspects that definitely make it feel dated.Anyone who plays more modern games may be at a bit of a loss during some levels though slow pacing and unclear objectives at times the last section of the game is by far the fastest and i found it a little difficult to figure out where to go next a little difficult at times.

Definitely worth a play if you want to play the Original Tho id recommend Black Mesa more going on as its age is starting to show.

Valve's debut is a visual masterpiece that must be experienced.

[h1]Ha envejecido mal. Muy mal.[/h1]

- En comparación con otros juegos similares de la misma época como puede ser Deux Ex, Hal Life empeora la jugabilidad, los gráficos, los modelos 3D, la IA, los sonidos, la iluminación...
- El movimiento se siente resbaladizo, rápido y sin aceleración, difícil de controlar sobre todo en las fases finales.
- Tiene un pequeño inconveniente de la época, en la que es necesario jugar el tutorial para entender algunas mecánicas como el salto agachado (imprescindible), o que te expliquen por ejemplo que con la F enciendes la linterna, pero no es obligatorio jugarlo.
- La batalla contra el boss final deja bastante que desear 

+ En general tiene niveles con bastante variedad, con zonas de plataformeo, otras de puzzles, otras de shooter 100%, lo cual es un gran punto a favor.
+ El doblaje al español no está mal para ser un juego de esa época.

[b] Posiblemente es un juego que ha hecho historia, pero no me enfrentaría al Half Life original ahora mismo por diversión.[/b] 
Quizá Black Mesa (el remake), mejore algunos de estos aspectos
Clasico de Clasicos, nunca pasa de moda, bastante gente aun lo juega
